example: In *The Awakening*, the sea symbolizes Edna’s freedom.
In *Fahrenheit 451*, fire represents censorship and rebirth.
In *I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings*, the bird symbolizes Maya’s struggle.
In *Dracula*, mirrors reflect the absence of a vampire’s soul.

meaning: Passage of time or stages of life.
example: In *The Outsiders*, winter symbolizes the characters’ hardships.
In *A Midsummer Night’s Dream*, the moon underscores the magical transformations.
In *Things Fall Apart*, the sun represents the strength of Okonkwo’s village.
In *The Name of the Rose*, roses symbolize hidden knowledge.
In *The Secret Garden*, the door to the garden symbolizes renewal.
In *The Jungle Book*, Kaa the snake symbolizes both danger and wisdom.
In *Heart of Darkness*, light symbolizes the illusion of civilization.
In *Macbeth*, darkness symbolizes guilt and moral decay.
In *The Alchemist*, mountains symbolize Santiago’s journey to enlightenment.
In *Their Eyes Were Watching God*, the pear tree symbolizes Janie’s desires.
In *The Raven*, the raven symbolizes Poe’s grief and despair.
In *The Scarlet Letter*, red symbolizes Hester’s sin and shame.
In *Moby-Dick*, the white whale symbolizes the unknowable nature of the universe.
In *Jane Eyre*, chains symbolize Jane’s societal constraints.
In *In the Time of the Butterflies*, butterflies represent the Mirabal sisters’ resistance.
In *The Great Gatsby*, clocks symbolize the passage of time and lost opportunities.
In *Bleak House*, fog symbolizes the obfuscation of truth in the legal system.
In *Rear Window*, windows symbolize Jeff’s perspective on others’ lives.
In *The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe*, Aslan the lion symbolizes Christ-like sacrifice.
In *Siddhartha*, the lotus symbolizes spiritual awakening.
In *Hamlet*, the skull of Yorick symbolizes the inevitability of death.
In *The Bridge on the River Kwai*, the bridge symbolizes conflicting loyalties.
In *Forrest Gump*, the feather symbolizes destiny and chance.
In *The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian*, crows symbolize Junior’s fears.
In *One Hundred Years of Solitude*, candles symbolize the fleeting nature of life.
In *Dune*, the desert symbolizes both hardship and destiny.
